intro: Eschweilera revoluta, commonly known as the red-eyed tree frog plant, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Lecythidaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and striking red or orange flowers. The plant produces woody fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
